graphics
Class Orientation

java.lang.Object
  graphics.Orientation

public class Orientation
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
kbok Represents the orientation of a Unit. It can be used to decide which Image to use.

toInt

public int toInt()
Returns the integer representation of the Orientation. Useful for addressing arrays.

Returns:
The integer representation, as int.

equalsTo

public boolean equalsTo(Orientation other)
Compares the Orientation to another. Two Orientations are equals if their integer representation are the same.

Parameters:
other - Orientation to compare to.
Returns:
Whether they are equal or not.

fromDxDy

public static Orientation fromDxDy(int dx,
                                   int dy)
Computes an Orientation from a difference between two Squares.

Parameters:
dx - The X difference.
dy - The Y difference.
Returns:
the Orientation computed.
